document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Arts, Media, and Entertainment

9760173EEF984CECBDC0C5C8110EE961.description: Demonstrate a professional level of written and oral communication as necessary in the game industry.

4D7A6DF168E94189B9F5C285B676AD1C.description: Apply listening, speaking, and collaborative communication skills to effectively convey information.

5CB59C4962D442D9B58287BF049B5BD6.description: Test and debug the completed game.

48917F1B15A1411A9B0DF3C5147579B3.description: Create sound and music to enhance the game experience.

8E1A9EA5A0C54331AB2DCD8FCF883AAC.description: Create and use animated objects in a game.

B93385106FB144659D3A536DAC012EB7.description: Use computer tools to create game programming, art, and audio.

6D87CCCBFEB844AC8CB8318BFBADD9C8.description: Use design documents to create a game design production plan.

65EFFA54D19C4E6F870CBB4EBFA2B3E3.description: Students will build a game that demonstrates teamwork and project management by creating a game design production plan that describes the game play, outcomes, controls, rewards, interface, and artistic style of a video game.

7E75C45DB9334F88907D430E5A457F68.description: Create a resume and use it during a mock interview. At the end of the interview process, apply negotiation skills as they relate to salary and benefits packages.

EF86E7F4A9F14FA3B4AD4A7A3BD7F457.description: Investigate the common employment contracts in the game industry, such as Nondisclosure Agreements, "Work for Hire" agreements, and "Noncompete" clauses.

21FB2A57C2B24F479F21FBA6FD6E08BB.description: Analyze job and career requirements as related to career interests and opportunities in the game industry.

0786AAB057F0452EB7A89B21468641C7.description: Use personal assessment tools to identify personal and professional strengths and weaknesses.

A19B3F73F3404F929E3ADFD4A891CE36.description: Investigate how the skills acquired in game design/development can be applied to other industries.

F42FDE76522E4E1F8757957B4C5EAAF4.description: Demonstrate personal and interpersonal skills appropriate for the workplace, such as responsibility, dependability, punctuality, positive attitude, initiative, respect for self and others, and professional dress.

A2586BB81B944E2AB74C7A6D96CA4065.description: Identify career goals and develop a career plan that explores employment opportunities in the video game industry.

DDA0D6664B5640A292D0E189771FBFEE.description: Design a game you believe will have positive impact on the world.

5E83848CF3414F7287750EF4737FA845.description: Explore and discuss the impact of video games on the economy.

6A05669451764C28A7C529246739542D.description: Describe how frequent exposure and/or access to video games has reshaped the level of technical proficiency of our workforce.

629B3D4B1AEB41B69ED4151D6AAE484C.description: Compare and contrast the different opinions on the effects of games on behavior, cognitive development, and motor skills.

0E3CD8D4A9F341DCA734D4C65D5DC9FD.description: Describe the benefits of games and simulations, including online economies and community building.

010488C4FECA4C09A11D28BC1F492398.description: Investigate and discuss how play can help humans acquire knowledge and social skills.

244E8803492849779840E8E4E43F4799.description: Discuss the word "play" and its many definitions.

6C4881CFEDB9429980AF9FBD04A6BF4F.description: Understand the impact of games and the role of play in human culture. Analyze the ethics and global impact of the game industry.

9DADC12F3C764ADC8700ADAE5100A6F2.description: Create a plan for a game to target a specific audience within three different countries while adhering to their governments' rating systems.

19E0AAFBD9E04BE7A0270B56733D06BB.description: Evaluate how video games adhere to government rating systems.

B44EED2260E14A71929B783F9613705A.description: Explore and describe the effects of globalization on the design and production of video games.

1BE69DFA3B73430FA43C0C19627665DF.description: Evaluate game journalism and professional reviews in terms of bias.

17CE0D0EEDD44D00B68A6FE19C0129BD.description: Discuss the relationships between publishers, developers, distributors, marketers, and retailers.

6DAA3414B7774FF8A162477EE8A30B83.description: Understand the role community management plays in marketing and business models.

D00607F908CE42C6A4A5A554E31E8E9F.description: Understand the components of marketing campaigns for games, including advertising in traditional and social media.

50EE0D9FB7274F89B7007C63F8BE900E.description: Identify successful business models and analyze various facets of those models, such as market analysis, marketing strategy, and product value.

F719E1A29B614B3293587275313885A0.description: Identify and describe licensing management for different game platforms, tools, and intellectual properties.

00005CC3E51448ADB3CFBC29771AF97A.description: Identify, define, and discuss the different ways games are funded, distributed, marketed, and sold.

9C5FF8AB57FE49748D45C265FF59F47B.description: Understand the fundamentals of business and marketing, including entrepreneurship, global marketing, and localization.

725DD4FABF1B40F1BC693A1A5F214B7F.description: Create a set of original design documents and build a small game.

BC0E176FBEC643028D809D7B6C317C7E.description: Compare and contrast common uses of different game development tools.

23E522B381FE492581CCCFFC2E630C6D.description: Describe the importance and interrelationship between development schedule and budget constraints in a video game design project.

BCCC13E776DA4EB6A0F9104A517C398A.description: Enumerate individual tasks of a project using basic time management skills to complete each task and track its completion.

18815825CBBD476C97A8A0B5859F5867.description: Develop design plans, character sketches, documentation, and storyboards for proposed games.

5C9B1C1AA3D64E2EBBB3A4AA4A466E56.description: Discuss the iterative nature of game and simulation design.

FE678961394942B596B6D4F69050BEEB.description: Identify processes of design and development from concept to production, including content creation, filling team roles, design documentation, communication, and scheduling for video game design teams.

65E9058B4EB74D0EA3B0C8993064CC9C.description: Understand the general procedures, documentation, and requirements of large scale game design projects. Examine and categorize the significant processes in the production of games.

91A3C7BE570D4C66866D8E883E8A28AE.description: Test a classmate's game project and create a bug report for the game. For each error submitted, write steps in sufficient detail so it is identifiable and reproducible to the developer. Use a metric to identify how critical the error is based on its negative impact on game play.

7A2590B9468245FCAE714F50BD4E41EC.description: Demonstrate technical reading and writing skills.

FB2D4DE11D814AF899E2823E6073E9B0.description: Evaluate games in terms of accessibility issues.

B0C55BF61B4B4E9BBBE16C23B877A902.description: Compare and contrast the differences between functionality and usability of software.

F122F3F8186340E6BADA6DFE737599F5.description: Identify the key elements in a game and make intelligent judgments about whether the game succeeded or failed in its objectives.

4E3BB8D00F3B40A6AA85BA1DD7C37CAC.description: Test and analyze games to determine the quality of rules, interfaces, navigation, performance, and game play.

1A797BCA53DD44749D10624DD8037CE8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of testing techniques used to evaluate, assess, rate, and review quality assurance of video games.

E7E3A21A1B0F4997A2F7E2A7DA2CB34E.description: Create a storyboard for a game cut-scene applying the basic principles of design and concepts of cinematography.

37D70E543A8640A687305B1E3021F050.description: Understand the basics of character design and development, world design, and level design.

969D66B7EB2B45CABBFB95D799226DE8.description: Define and discuss intellectual property, copyrights, trademarks, and piracy as they relate to art and multimedia assets in a game.

C5BBB02A1A33413495B32DD4FEFD2B90.description: Create, record, and edit audio for a game.

D30EEF4F2B8B42E99B59D22E28C748B7.description: Design a game environment using lines, fills, and color to set a specific mood and feel of a scene.

495B82F7097349D99FEACD242A728F40.description: Explain how to create the illusion of 3-D in a 2-D environment.

A00794C8C7C24A72A863734A45D47626.description: Research and describe the different perspectives used in video games, including first person, second person, and third person perspectives.

1B33E54E0C824AF1B2893797733E692E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the elements of art, including line, shape, color, value, texture, space, and balance, to set the mood and feel of a scene.

E9052DFA2206432E8913D76072770336.description: Students will demonstrate mastery of game art and multimedia, including music, sound, art, and animation.

311497E4501446DFA0B146AB6D5BF8EE.description: Implement a small video game utilizing mathematics and physics that features at least one moving object (such as a spaceship) which rotates along an axis and moves in whichever direction it is facing after rotation. The game must include collision physics.

9C8F44D07E294536B7EAC568362D0982.description: Explore the basics of random number generation.

9B2053C262ED486E94B74A510EEAAD21.description: Examine the use of math and physics (such as gravity and friction) in game development.

8A5DA9A2A19C4CB596A7B265407B48B7.description: Understand the basics of game physics, including collision and motion.

DE0C36C5950540FDBB691AA41FA9F0C0.description: Implement common programming concepts, including logic operators, conditional statements, loops, variables, events, actions, and handling user input.

E3C13C91CC554A0A894514BAF4EAED5F.description: Acquire and apply appropriate game programming concepts and skills to develop a playable video game.

03A73BEF0C3F441997CE79443D56B91A.description: Prototype a small game using real-world objects, such as dice, cards, balls, pen and paper, etc.

51B5FC52B85C44B7A8AD04EA865A7695.description: Describe a designer-centric game to highlighting features other than game play and entertainment value.

A1666B50246F4EB7A5BC03B30D78064E.description: Compare and contrast player-centric design and designer-centric design in video games.

90B7C2F101F44946AD3C21F4801F0709.description: Explore and explain the factors that create player immersion in a game.

A8661E559C4A42DB820E9711589EA1CC.description: Research and define the term "player immersion."

2C4EA427A42047BEA0DD4F1DA178C2D4.description: Research various input controls and display types then identify how these impact game play.

5FC625998D5C40CD8FD0642A7DBCABAA.description: Break down and identify the fundamental building blocks of game play: player goals, player actions, rewards, and challenges.

0C1332C168C34FD1894CE4C3FEFCE99B.description: Identify and define the roles and responsibilities of each member of a video game design team.

0BC450D17E6443969E15C45FBC02AF8E.description: Analyze the core tasks and challenges of video game design and explore the methods used to create and sustain player immersion.

5739836AA2EC4044A47653BF30F0ED87.description: Present a mock-up of a future generation game platform and hardware system based on research of current and emerging technologies and future predictions.

0E08339CABBC49D5932BD77A5A4C8BA2.description: Analyze the technology transfer from video games to other industries, such as education, medical, corporate training, and military simulation.

FBBD35BEC41F4393A9CA81BFF53E09C0.description: Research, compare, and categorize different game platforms and game hardware.

8D1AAB326F0641FFA278CE22EF41C0AB.description: Define and use necessary vocabulary related to games, their genres, game platforms, and game hardware.

68E895714895458AAAA2096834DFB243.description: Research and analyze different game genres, including multiplayer games.

D473FBD8127740A6908ECE3690248A15.description: Demonstrate understanding of current trends and the historical significance of both electronic and non-electronic games. Students will analyze different game systems and identify how these systems have influenced consumer technology.

comments: Students who follow the Game Design and Integration pathway prepare for careers within the game design industry and in related technical fields. Students will develop foundational knowledge in game design, animation, graphics, and computer software and hardware. They will apply skills in Mathematics, Physics, English Language Arts, Social Science, and Entrepreneurship. Most importantly, students will learn the twenty-first century skills of creativity, critical thinking, communication, collaboration, and technical expertise, which will increase employment capacity across the job market. In the Game Design and Integration Pathway students prepare for both entry-level employment and additional postsecondary training needed for advancement in the highly competitive game design industry. They prepare for occupations such as Game Tester/Analyst, 2-D and 3-D Animator, Storyboard, Level Artist, Texture Artist, Cinematic Artist, Game Designer, Game Programmer, and Production Team Manager. Students completing this pathway develop the skills and knowledge to be creative partners in video game design while building capacity for employment in all areas of the creative workforce.

0569A74BF5E741D5A7C374A131749761.description: Demonstrate understanding of the distribution component of both live and media based production including Web, print, radio, television, and communication based options.

2B92B604C15548F0BD441E8D5B59956A.description: Understand the components of marketing campaigns for live and media based productions, including advertising in both traditional and social media.

EA772E21B1F44856B122069BCF0A5AF6.description: Understand the role of audience and market research in promotional planning

F5D888FC9C6C4AFFAED00FC269BB7B2E.description: Discuss the relationships between publishers, developers, distributors, marketers, and retailers.

B0203469863B4D92A8F80E99D5456B07.description: Identify successful business models and analyze various facets of those models, such as market analysis, marketing strategy, and product value.

A5AD132C45814DEDAFFFB03357D0C174.description: Identify and describe licensing management for live and media based productions and intellectual properties.

4273FB7DBDB74426A41039CD8821BF21.description: Know various media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods, including written, oral, visual, and electronic media.

18AF7C6A3F534F32B904E3F2801129FA.description: Create a public service announcement using two or more production methods materials, such as standard public service announcements

31274CD2842F4C8DA21FA5218F778F96.description: Create a promotional example using electronic media.

88637885CB4640D29F39304D60EBFC08.description: Design a promotional packet demonstrating knowledge of promotional

766D5DCF76144123B8CDCC3F65DB4C57.description: Create a budget for an aspect of an arts, media, and entertainment production of the arts, media, and entertainment industry.

386F461DAAD1460EA8543C1F4B4D8BB5.description: Design a production flow chart identifying chain of responsibility for a specific type of arts, media, and entertainment production.

C8AC396D463C4AA783C246C4E58913AE.description: Understand the key elements of developing and promoting a production from creation to distribution.

50067E0DE1254E8CA64F3C235B7DF6D7.description: Plan the general coordination of various elements in a project or production.

A795B89FCA86418A875906187B2FBE25.description: Identify essential qualifications and technological competencies for each team member, including artists, designers, performers, composers, writers, and technicians.

0B8941AF07104788973A10A00A05733C.description: Apply knowledge of services, equipment capabilities, the workflow process, data acquisition, and technology to a timely completion of projects.

8C8465303BE44F078286CDF6B50C2AE0.description: Create a call sheet for equipment, crew, technical support, and cast requirements for an arts, media, and entertainment production.

F316205108E342A5A464051A96C81373.description: Demonstrate understanding of the appropriate use of technology in each phase of the production planning.

053E6EE36B4E4C33828095CD0C02DC23.description: Identify the responsibilities and activities associated with the preproduction, production, and post-production of a creative project.

F984B73341E449D6B0DBB213B871EB6A.description: Know how artistic processes, organizational structure, and business principles, including funding and budgeting, are interrelated in both live and media production.

FD1054DA0FBD430D862F15672715E644.description: Know the main elements and functional responsibilities involved in the production and presentation of the performing, visual, and media arts.

1C9D1490543F4850B41CE894F187A817.description: Demonstrate key skills and an understanding of the complexities of production planning.

CC1D63ACCDC04E159AECFC80E4B72B0F.description: Identify the skills and competencies of the various members of a production team including producer, production manager, director, assistant director, stage manager, production designer(s), post production, etc.

027DE8D75D6B4B01B5A79A706950D1A6.description: Analyze and differentiate the function of the various members of a production team.

32F3C5D0F7684DC5B9EE7D3FEA0E5928.description: Plan one technical component of a production from design to performance.

C383714F856A41A1A1D7BEE7EAEC4D3F.description: Produce a production flow chart for a live theatrical or media based production.

03E6F834A63C4780BD7239BA97F31CA7.description: Analyze the production sequence involved in creating a media based or live performance production.

BEF83589FF2C4BCF84B4A4A7DD815036.description: Understand the technical support functions and artistic competencies in film, video, and live production.

A994BE010F0748E982292EB41E42A7A2.description: Apply safety related decision making and problem-solving techniques to live, recorded, or multimedia generated production.

9977548ABE7C4097AB86B4490EC2C10C.description: Demonstrate understanding of safe workplace practices, including tool safety, rigging, electrical, and construction safety and awareness of hazardous materials in the workplace.

38CF8F87DE694719B3EC25D3D851CD90.description: Demonstrate knowledge of basic electrical safety.

9C0488EA1AFC41EF8254D8796148D643.description: Demonstrate understanding of various power tools used in construction and rigging.

AC623C677AE1418D80A675D843AAE851.description: Demonstrate knowledge of industry safety standards and practices in all areas of technical production.

comments: Whatever the form or medium of creative expression, all careers in the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector require "publication" or a public presentation in one way or another. Consequently, the Production and Managerial Arts pathway focuses on both the technical skills and the organizational and managerial knowledge necessary to bring arts, media, and entertainment to the public.

5E4AC773AD46493BA74A9B2D63C0F858.description: Create a career plan leading to professional performance in one of the performance disciplines.

5349591E18554FAD81B2C36877BE18EB.description: Contrast differing roles in professional skill sets of creators, performers, and others involved in the production and presentation of the performing arts.

B9090D747131427F8FED01E0638C6494.description: Understand the technical aspects of lights, sound, properties, costumes, and makeup from the perspective of the professional performer.

47B2B387291942BC8C1C462005B4903A.description: Demonstrate entry-level competencies for a career in an artistic or technical field in the theatrical arts.

E45A3898765C4E9AA8599A34F9FA4420.description: Demonstrate effective knowledge and skills with the audiovisual equipment and technology used in professional performance.

43A558A639B0420F96DCAFD4192EF2FD.description: Examine the training, education, and experience needed to pursue discipline-specific performance options.

CC71AC3C16A44848BCCEDE119D4E0061.description: Explore the connection between artistic preparation and professional standards and practices.

40051D2B9E174B979048CEE42A28773E.description: Use complex evaluation criteria and terminology to compare and contrast a variety of genres of professional performance products.

ECBC70D4AA8F4107A53F5D5C29D54F0F.description: Analyze the aesthetic principles that apply in a professional work designed for live performance, film, video, or live broadcast.

6219E1EA4FE24BDE9B6F010BEEB25E68.description: Use selected criteria to compare, contrast, and assess various professional performance forms.

E6FA24D276E44A46939CDC52B0F02836.description: Critique discipline-specific professional works using the language and terminology specific to the discipline.

FFF0D95F06164DEB98265A10BF600A4B.description: Deconstruct the aesthetic values that drive professional performance and the artistic elements necessary for industry production.

EC45D23C027B460D82228CE0813D1C7A.description: Create a product comparing and contrasting universal themes and sociopolitical issues in a variety of music, dance, or theatrical products.

F445141C53BC4B60A749EFF3B5FB3C97.description: Analyze the historical and cultural perspective of the actor and performance artist in the professional setting.

CD9693EF670E44FD8B5A3BF4F60C29AB.description: Analyze the historical and cultural perspective of the musician in the professional setting.

71BBD548AE374AFC8B82CF6DE917921B.description: Analyze the historical and cultural perspective of the dancer in the professional setting.

0ADB2F54BFDF43BFA8BE99B744A7F404.description: Identify and compare how film, theater, television, and electronic media productions influence values and behaviors.

0EAFC4296E7849FDBEAB46E7F0BB1C76.description: Analyze the historical and cultural perspective of multiple industry performance products from a discipline-specific perspective.

8C62BA3D2CFF489991858F74BA97B091.description: Work collaboratively as designer, producer, or actor to meet directorial goals in scenes and plays from a variety of professional sources.

45226DD7C21C4677865D399B1F4B78C8.description: Improvise or write dialogues and scenes applying basic dramatic structure (exposition, complication, crises, climax, and resolution) appropriate to a variety of industry settings.

0DB9276AB15B4ADEB74C8B79AA3177D3.description: Design, produce, or perform scenes applicable to a variety of professional settings and media applications.

060A2E2883234C6C93FF6F7E04B01F44.description: Create performance products applying basic dramatic structure: exposition, complication, conflict, crises, climax, and resolution.

EB5712ED14914FA1B39CDBFA782410F2.description: Use acting choices, such as script analysis, character research, reflection, and revision; and apply to a variety of professional settings.

F395EE72D79D48578DEBC2CD8F90BB36.description: Demonstrate media appropriate acting choices using script analysis, character research, reflection, and revision in live and recorded performance applications.

FCFEFEDD61E545B996CF44E58FBD385A.description: Apply skill and knowledge in acting, directing, design, and composition to create formal and informal (improvised) theater, film, video, and electronic media performances.

A0482AB53F0F433CA3A820EB5C567493.description: Create melodic and rhythmic improvisations in a style or genre within a musical culture (gamelan, jazz, and mariachi).

E0D82E518A4D4E09BE844F89D2ED87F2.description: Compose and arrange music for various combinations of voice and acoustic and digital/electronic instruments using appropriate ranges and traditional and nontraditional sound sources.

A466C3167C904AA2A0F3E4E9C2A183DE.description: Employ a variety of music technology to record, integrate, or modify a live or recorded performance to produce a new artistic product.

B040EDF236DC4EADB5073D2FF9072ED8.description: Sight read and perform a brief musical composition from a professional resource.

75E76F409A3D4BD9A20C0EF915FFB1AB.description: Sing or play music written in multiple parts, individually or with a group.

91737E5AF8DC496DBC7BF87F29AC21CF.description: Sing or play a repertoire of musical literature representing various genres, styles, and cultures with expression and technical accuracy.

9D375D99064A45DBB3C3493F696B0CD0.description: Apply vocal and/or instrumental skill and knowledge to perform a varied repertoire of music appropriate to music industry application.

6A513F2C7C9D4D38A7C61E4443E0CE91.description: Perform original works that employ personal artistic intent and respond to industry-specific criteria.

D618AF3E54A3467F9DF9C68A51C43BD2.description: Create a performance piece using dance structures, musical forms, theatrical elements, and technology for a specific professional application.

9A81AC893AA6468099FB60C421D1BF34.description: Create a diverse body of work in dance, which demonstrates originality, unity, clarity of intent, and a dynamic range of movement appropriate to a variety of professional applications.

4052C24295D147E6A54408AA0696CB63.description: Perform combinations, in response to audition requirements, in a variety of professional dance genres that demonstrate proficiency relative to industry expectations.

4EFC78AB5E7E43E2ABCCECFD120B5056.description: Perform works by various dance artists communicating the original intent of the work while employing personal artistic intent and interpretation.

E166F4D4AD0F4CBFA9B9EC7CCCC372EE.description: Create a dance that utilizes an established dance style or genre in response to an industry-specific prompt.

32D74205D6094771B996AB42F0231631.description: Apply basic music elements (rhythm, meter, tempo, timbre) to construct and perform dances for a variety of professional settings.

976C25F1418D4244B1B71032F553F86D.description: Notate dances using a variety of systems (Labanotation, motif writing, and personal systems).

CB088E45C30B4F5FA543E8BC4622E9B6.description: Specify applications of VPA Creative Expression Standards for Dance at the proficient level.

E152B95921D84CBD88FDE1E5D20DB44E.description: Apply choreographic principles, processes, and skills to create and communicate meaning through improvisation, composition, and performance of dance for a variety of professional applications.

D23DC8065EF24B13BCEC151CED757B40.description: Create a product which assesses professional theater, film, and video performance products using the vocabulary of theater, such as genre, style, acting values, theme, and design.

8669E48232024FE88DA67FB2D9F1FF1A.description: Research, analyze, and plan a theatrical performance (live or recorded) with the director, designer, or playwright.

2BF57FB448434D3AB352B4719BB815B4.description: Identify the use of metaphor, subtext, and symbolic elements in text and performance of professional theatrical work (live or recorded).

6E8A1CFD0D8343D9A7981491B5666698.description: Observe, deconstruct, and analyze peer and professional theater, film, video, and electronic media and respond using the vocabulary of theater.

E3156F27848C4C7E8A175BDE59DD4B90.description: Demonstrate the different uses of form, both past and present, in a varied repertoire of music in commercial settings from diverse genres, styles, and professional applications.

7A5BD4561BE243CAB90919F97F9D5B63.description: Analyze and describe the use of musical elements in a given professional work that makes it unique, interesting, and expressive.

3E22199A94F34275A17DB648AADDBC90.description: Analyze and describe significant musical events perceived and remembered in a given industry generated example.

B5F1387F29E34E5DADA2FBF40C15F535.description: Transcribe simple songs into melodic and rhythmic notation when presented.

1FB0D6D45D1E461E9A1C737495EE357A.description: Describe how the elements of music are used.

75480249FB4340ED9346FA6F1CCFE4BF.description: Read a full instrument or vocal score with a direct industry connection (Film score, Philharmonic score, commercial underscore).

350683252FE04289B154C36CD3269049.description: Read, listen to, deconstruct, and analyze peer and professional music using the elements and terminology of music.

F2E5937214D54945BD8E24AFC7016B14.description: Deconstruct formal and informal (improvisational) performances of theater, dance, and music, both live and electronic, and evaluate using appropriate artistic vocabulary.

6C5F23B650634371A3DD3B5F23DF0950.description: Perform in multiple professional dance genres integrating an advanced level of technical skill and clear intent.

7E9ED19116B2415F9E12AF8AD8E7B30F.description: Create and perform complicated works of dance at a level of professionalism (i.e., a high level of refinement).

2A5D8E578E1040E29EB856E383CED532.description: Differentiate dance vocabulary to describe movement and dance in a professional setting.

980361179D804BCC8769082335336568.description: Apply a wide range of kinesthetic communication demonstrating clarity of intent and stylistic nuance.

1E0A2E4609EB4B708B6218D3B9E5E4C1.description: Apply highly developed physical coordination and control when performing complex loco motor and axial movement phrases from a variety of genres (e.g., refined body articulation, agility, balance, strength).

A23957D32E354A0F8F7316F869400536.description: Demonstrate movement skills, process sensory information, and describe movement using the professional vocabulary of dance.

4F8E62F36FEC4C3A930A08C09CBBD222.description: Explore and formulate responses to peer and professional work using the fundamental elements of Theater, Dance, and Music.

comments: The Performing Arts pathway focuses on the direct creation of art and entertainment by the individual artist instead of through a secondary physical medium. Performing artists are themselves the medium of creative expression.

D2659E1CF4164B928481CB607E797446.description: Evaluate how advanced and emerging technologies (e.g., virtual environment or voice recognition software) affect or improve media and design arts products or productions.

DB6B21A503CA41BBB8CB7F53DF31B4C1.description: Analyze and assess technical support options related to various media and design arts.

27A7AA085D6E41CFBD768912C950A306.description: Differentiate writing processes, formats, and conventions used for various media.

92B1F0A7306B476EAF67339E49EA122E.description: Analyze the way in which technical design (e.g., color theory, lighting, graphics, typography, posters, sound, costumes, makeup) contributes to an artistic product, performance, or presentation.

5C263FED72FF4DBD9C4106B5FD16EA62.description: Know the features and uses of current and emerging technology related to computing (e.g., optical character recognition, sound processing, cable TV, cellular phones).

2E3BB1ACBCFD4DB7AEA5C9FF78E9DE2A.description: Use technology to create a variety of audio, visual, written, and electronic products and presentations.

5A9F95C818224E58B9DD0B32A5A9CF10.description: Understand the component steps and skills required to design, edit, and produce a production for audio, video, electronic, or printed presentation.

98CF2EE7B9E94FE5B867E524F4E73BDE.description: Understand the key technical and technological requirements applicable to various segments of the Media and Design Arts Pathway.

83C67C62007F437093D0CB3850A175AA.description: Revise text to highlight the individual voice, improve sentence variety and style, and enhance subtlety of meaning and tone in ways that are consistent with the purpose, audience, and genre.

50DD7DD1A18345E29BD0A62971D52447.description: Integrate databases, graphics, and spreadsheets into electronically processed documents.

724506BA0D414F2888C1430D41749796.description: Enhance meaning by employing rhetorical devices, including extended use of parallelism, repetition, analogy; incorporation of visual aids (e.g., graphs, tables, pictures); and the issuance of a call for action.

2E6BAD0A339640C6A896F4CAFE44AAA4.description: Use language in natural, fresh, and vivid ways to establish a specific tone.

EFEDB5A620904F38B51436D6FF42B52F.description: Use point of view, characterization, style (e.g., use of irony), and related elements for specific rhetorical and aesthetic purposes.

CBE93E84B0F34929A11E93651031B5B4.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the elements of discourse (e.g., purpose, speaker, audience, form) when completing narrative, expository, persuasive, or descriptive writing assignments.

96C3441A976E4ED8A4AC236C72022FCA.description: Debate the philosophical arguments presented in literary works to determine whether the authors' positions have contributed to the quality of each work and the credibility of the characters (philosophical approach).

511DCC1CE57C47C08C727D0A6F46F148.description: Analyze the way in which authors through the centuries have used archetypes drawn from myth and tradition in literature, film, political speeches, and religious writings.

89734BEA6D624E65BEAD34A5FF93AEB9.description: Evaluate the ways in which irony, tone, mood, the author's style, and the "sound" of language achieve specific rhetorical or aesthetic purposes or both.

B562369E781F4450AD24490C120734E5.description: Analyze characteristics of subgenres (e.g., satire, parody, allegory, pastoral) that are used in poetry, prose, plays, novels, short stories, essays, and other basic genres.

7298DFD18A584AA396752CE06A1396B3.description: Synthesize traditional art work and new technologies to design an artistic product to be used by a specific industry.

1838016E44DE430683671F124585B57C.description: Prepare portfolios of original art created for a variety of purposes and commercial applications.

E4B6B0B1C63E49D4BA960859C8B7789F.description: Create a commercial artistic product that communicates a cross-cultural or universal theme.

736128629AFD4FBC92652BAAF8C9F116.description: Predict how changes in technology might change the role and function of the visual arts in the workplace.

F98E7C58DAC1407C9B0563A979F4BA21.description: Deconstruct works of art, identifying psychological content found in the symbols and images and their relationship to industry and society.

B38634178E7842C2B3DDD3EAF7B3941F.description: Explore the role of art and design across various industry sectors and content areas.

03953669A2984E01BC3B96264664555F.description: Compare and contrast the ways in which different artistic media (television, newspapers, magazines, and electronic media) cover the same commercial content.

384AAFB1D0254C539DF047FD0FCC8AA8.description: Identify essential industry competencies, explore commercial applications and develop a career specific personal plan.

51CE10CE4CC34009A593993CD8154735.description: Create an artistic product for a specific industry and modify that product to accommodate a different aesthetic perspective.

76013F6380244FDA8396A9BB441C654D.description: Analyze and articulate how society influences the interpretation and effectiveness of an artistic product.

B07A595EA9B74E259B9736EB31EBCBD3.description: Analyze the relationship between the artist, artistic product and audience in both an existing and self-generated project.

D44E037A8C754A9793DB3097E19E76A9.description: Analyze the aesthetic value of a specific commercial work of art and defend that analysis from an industry perspective.

990E70BF28C14F318D34A5CC3DAFA809.description: Deconstruct how beliefs, cultural traditions, and current social, economic, and political contexts influence commercial media (traditional and electronic).

564E04B039BA48E583922B235B6C4CA5.description: Develop written consumer assessment rubrics for separate, industry-specific art products.

62E86B736AA545C5B8B504B01FE47861.description: Analyze, assess, and identify effectiveness of artistic products based on elements of art, the principles of design, and professional industry standards.

6857DACE5F054C38A0EBD35DD1EC428F.description: Investigate and discuss universal concepts expressed in visual media products from diverse cultures.

662900DECF13414D93F315F597DA43CA.description: Analyze similarities and differences of purpose in art created in culturally diverse industry applications.

97382D16F1D84250B2B0FD843E52339E.description: Identify art in international industry and discuss ways in which the work reflects cultural perspective.

BFEE72E6055549248EB461959B3C5DDD.description: Identify contemporary styles and discuss the diverse social, economic, and political developments reflected in art work in an industry setting.

61EA9C4F428544D396F8C455FE26123C.description: Describe how the issues of time, place, and cultural influence and are reflected in a variety of artistic products.

738D695B116E451B844020E37DE3721F.description: Identify and describe the role and influence of new technologies on contemporary arts industry.

F025FD8DF0C54819B095E796E54487C0.description: Analyze and assess the impact of history and culture on the development of professional arts and media products.

4288BF0C1BC3413EB66BB34A5AB0CB09.description: Create a multimedia work of art that demonstrates knowledge of media and technology skills.

9C07D4BAFF3A455286F0A20E853A224D.description: Plan and create artistic products that reflect complex ideas, such as distortion, color theory, arbitrary color, scale, expressive content, and real versus virtual.

6E47B3284BF64DAA850E3413A3B308C1.description: Create original works of art of increasing complexity and skill in a variety of media that reflect their feelings and points of view.

0AB4F6265B884AFFB8A23FD839F38A59.description: Create an artistic product that involves the effective use of the elements of art and the principles of design.

1EFDFB408A454D908EDB27A6A99B4D6B.description: Compile a portfolio of multiple original two- and three-dimensional works of art that reflect technical skills in an industry-relevant application.

62C1E2B8A1814FCDA400FD1A49408AD0.description: Use visual metaphors in creating an artistic product.

13BF4B039C7B43CB979D6DDE9B718E8C.description: Apply refined observation and drawing skills to solve an industry-relevant problem.

1E4E8FFED9D4490EB9A1BFAC8012D3AC.description: Demonstrate personal style and advanced proficiency in communicating an idea, theme, or emotion in an industry-relevant artistic product.

D9D0A68DE0DF4A2A83DDCA42DDEFB816.description: Demonstrate skill in the manipulation of digital imagery (either still or video) in an industry-relevant application.

FB2DB5AE38BF4ADEA0C2FF0BD71FB6B9.description: Apply artistic skills and processes to solve a variety of industry-relevant problems in a variety of traditional and electronic media.

B1BE679660B24B5892634E8D2DA5A31A.description: Analyze the material used by a given artist and describe how its use influences the meaning of the work.

D32466EE90ED44A9B5F9E4673CAD9148.description: Compare how distortion is used in a variety of media to modify the message being communicated.

71989C68BAC14EF59A0F74D942D4BFD5.description: Analyze and discuss complex ideas, such as distortion, color theory, arbitrary color, scale, expressive content, and real versus virtual in works of art.

75B7F761A72B4F5EAC84A61305B5A03E.description: Compare and analyze art work done using electronic media with those done with materials traditionally used in the visual arts.

4B23FF1DA9854B6E93A7D02955903B72.description: Research and analyze the work of an artist or designer and how the artist's distinctive style contributes to their industry production.

1575910DE6804A6B93CBF4F54C301C5A.description: Select industry-specific works and analyze the intent of the work and the appropriate use of media.

84BD5BC0DCD3473EBC7BBFB0C53149DE.description: Describe the use of the elements of art to express mood in digital or traditional art work found in the commercial environment.

72A0567175AE451B82EF1079C67DC237.description: Identify and use the principles of design to discuss, analyze, and create projects and products across multiple industry applications.

5D91D3AC932F41299155AE14FEBC748B.description: View and respond to a variety of industry-related artistic products integrating industry appropriate vocabulary.

69B93DDB26D143F19F608782B7F8EB2B.description: Demonstrate ability to reorganize and integrate visual art elements across digital media and design applications.

16119B3816334DCE81B01DAC9BB6C23F.description: Design, Visual, and Media Arts Pathway
comments: The Design, Visual, and Media Arts pathway includes those occupations that use visual art, digital media, and Web-based tools and materials as the primary means of communication and expression. In addition to an understanding of current workplace practice, this career pathway requires the development of knowledge and skills in both visual art concepts as well as new and emerging digital processes by which individuals are able to create and communicate complex concepts in a broad range of occupations and professions.

7F7B689486D34307A9469D1B17AE4A2F.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

23C822EF7A7C45858AA2E4B2C7DE3D45.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector opportunities.

D3D4A794728B47D1BB3D00D8C6226A1A.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

0CB104147F87458B910AB9047778834F.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

4E326277CEAA45F7A335AFE7CB819EF7.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Arts, Media, and Entertainment anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory, and workplace settings, and through the SkillsUSA career technical student organizations.

D96DE350FDBB4471A62613CCF396A5CC.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

5CE72E3C93544BA1A4597A781E277519.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector requirements and expectations.

A108A62B35B942918549C356EE8D9125.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector.

969DC4511E414DECA775D97FD73C7813.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

0BC1F8E9358F4F2FA5FDC8A75775E8CE.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector issues and problems.

24051560558F49399373B0A1E1D7F3CE.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

CD2F1CCB31024A2AB56BFAA891ED0C83.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

981FAE344C6C4ED7900FDF151555918E.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

768E0956DAFA4E61B7096F66BE5C8794.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

07DBA2728CD749EEAC1275BA2C668092.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

5FA2109EBB2A4B029108E7ED42EF51ED.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the SkillsUSA career technical student organizations.

FA54C5EF8F534659855B136D9655E3F1.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector laws and practices.

A9423EE451434563A613D3969AD9B203.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

800CF50AD3854CD9BE586A5A760FA196.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

275D23AE517A4041942C30C6E2003F33.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

6A528CE961E342C0806BD9D371D08EAB.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector workplace standards.

C5F87360B2A745A985D4EF02F74A9C74.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment industry sector.

514C3B0A364948A1BDF48D182B5C297D.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

8B845FACC657459A955951E8736DA3ED.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector.

AC4D43FFF58E4A06AA4E4B8E417E86BD.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

DC5F16261D0148E1A9E0C1D297AEBC8E.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

119C71462C4A4CDA95B208F208C51649.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

A0F13F8149CE41E88A2D45C637C1257A.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

4A8ED54BE26A40D8B88D6591D81FE1C3.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

07A708C63D934072BA557CCA8EB36FCD.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

76954BAE9ED2497B8695F5A1E03B28BE.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector workplace environment and community settings.

A969F2005D5149CA9A3E7EE0775A4C64.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

AF97ACAAB666418C88EE39BAC7C6F740.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

A318EFFD0F6D4B88AC5A9984E7F34861.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

186CB33BC6504D1FA0028787F06CB633.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

5F87CB6CA5554746B49BD7A8C37BCB01.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

E02260FC5FF74D1DBE4A60CB3B9CC811.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

D6F9A2034CE949748FA2BAE595628E86.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector workplace environment.

CCD39BF19AA348E3A240280FAA82C3E3.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

890205A88CEE4C83A6AF44AE3B7625A3.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

C71F072E116E4F82BC0877AF6F6AFF1C.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

6A368977E69C4C1D89E3F432193E4210.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short as well as more sustained research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector, using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

68FBF27AB8944C62BBE753CB50B58C83.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

09F65A140934495FBD1BEE4230C08889.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

C130F71521E34D57A4E6A15B3B2982C6.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

2964B1092BED4457AF8C9B793B504C57.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

51F7BA76922848EEB9575E30CF704B5E.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

9DE24F61502F47C5A7D915A38581002A.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector workplace environment.

8B7E455F21424F8FB94D63519C56190F.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

11C55AF0307B49B0ADB2473F29276D32.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

4155437079E149708462076E7E6BDDE1.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

E78F0A99E7A74AABB2D700F0CD9F974E.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

D722772DD5C14568B108F0AC4DD48662.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

381ECA454B674F789A4357F165CFFB0B.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

C3699F3488B348F0AB5D5B2ACFA8C9B9.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

6C96C48875824C11A0FCAB8B712D5A02.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

A9F4465258A340E6A44F69C8CF89FFC0.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

EBB618A3C0A84084A8A2CEF89BB06C3B.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

80776859EC474E4B824E9EDAA5EA9354.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

A3AC7F5695174FC381276E9DFEED6A7D.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

4CF093F5DA784DF5BC67C22FE3D50A0C.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

2FFB4B60A9134BDF9A4E5C2EC156ECA9.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

26DC5BD728C04E0F94D243232815AC3B.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Arts, Media, and Entertainment sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Arts, Media, and Entertainment academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
